content:
Get to know Okta
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.The Field CTO role within Okta is a high impact position focused on serving as an evangelist through strategic and industry events, supporting strategic sales opportunities, and working closely with prospects and existing customers to shape engineering and product priorities. You will be one of our thought leading technical experts, and are a well-rounded and well-regarded technologist at heart who has a deep understanding of the Identity & Access Management industry category and/or IT/Security adjacencies. This is a highly influential role and requires dynamic communications and presentation skills amongst varied audiences of both business and technology leaders. You are just as adept at engaging with the customer’s CISO as you are at working closely with internal product and engineering teams.
Responsibilities

Leverage industry knowledge and expertise to establish relationships with customer C-suite executives
You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context
Strategic involvement in industry leadership events
Drive thought leadership opportunities with marketing and field teams
Be a trusted advisor for Okta’s product and engineering teams
Collect, distill and communicate customer needs and product requirements to cross functional counterparts across product management, engineering, marketing and sales
Work closely with Product Marketing and demand generation teams to spread awareness and support pipeline building via customer touch points (round tables, workshops, etc), conferences, strategic events, thought leadership blogs, webinars and 
white papers
Contribute to the creation of reference architectures, technical materials, best practices, etc. based on field experience to continue to up-level and enable our internal stakeholders

Experience & Skills

10+ years of product, technical marketing or pre-sales engineering experience
15+ years of experience in IT/security (ex: identity, web application development, security, risk and/or compliance, or IT infrastructure)
Recent identity and/or cybersecurity experience in a relevant industry strongly preferred
Ability to interact with and influence senior executives within the Public Sector Community ( SLED and Federal)
Experience in customer-facing roles explaining strategic and technical concepts
Ability to act as an industry thought leader with customers, prospects and at industry events
Ability to travel 50%+ of the time

#LI Remote
